This assumes ${WORKSPACE} points to the directory above CommandScripts and source.

The script SetCylonEnv.sh assumes that the cross compiler was installed on Ubuntu using:
1.  sudo apt-get install gcc-arm-linux-gnueabi
If this is not the case, edit CommandScripts/LinuxTools/SetEnvCrossCompileCylon.sh to change
the paths to point to the correct toolchain

Note the procedure below installs fcgi for the Cylon cross compiler. 
To install fcgi for the Ubuntu x86_64 compiler, delete the entire
fcgi_2.4.1_SNAP-0311112127 directory and repeat steps 4 through 9 using
SetLinuxEnv.sh.

Installation procedure:
1.	Create the /home/builder3di/SetupAndInstall/DownloadFastCgi directory on the
   build machine.
2.	cd /home/builder3di/SetupAndInstall/DownloadFastCgi
3.	wget http://www.fastcgi.com/dist/fcgi.tar.gz
4.	tar -xvf fcgi.tar.gz
5.	source ${WORKSPACE}/CommandScripts/LinuxTools/SetCylonEnv.sh
6.	cd fcgi-2.4.1-SNAP-0311112127
7.	./configure --build=${CROSS_COMPILE_BUILD} --host=${CROSS_COMPILE_HOST} --prefix=${CROSS_COMPILE_FULL_HOST}/usr
8.	make "CFLAGS=-DEOF=-1" "CXXFLAGS=-DEOF=-1"
9.	sudo make install


cd ${WORKSPACE}
. CommandScripts/LinuxTools/SetJenkinsEnvBeagleBone.sh
cd ~
mkdir fcgi
tar -xvf ${COMMON_THIRDPARTY_HOME}/libfcgi/LinuxHost/fcgi.tar.gz
cd fcgi-2.4.1-SNAP-0311112127
./configure --build=${CROSS_COMPILE_BUILD} --host=${CROSS_COMPILE_HOST} --prefix=${CROSS_COMPILE_FULL_HOST}/usr
make "CFLAGS=-DEOF=-1" "CXXFLAGS=-DEOF=-1"
sudo make install
